messages.content: schedule a message to send on whatsapp is that possible?

Short answer: WhatsApp (personal) doesn’t have true “send later.”  
You’ve got a few workable options:

1) iPhone (no jailbreak)
- You can use Shortcuts → Automation → “Time of Day” → “Open URLs” with:
  `https://wa.me/<countrycode+number>?text=<your%20message>`
- Add a second action “Open App → WhatsApp” (optional).
- iOS will still ask you to confirm—one tap sends.

2) Android (no root)
- Most reliable: set a Calendar/Alarm reminder that opens a wa.me link like above. Tap once to send.
- Apps that claim auto-sending usually rely on accessibility (tap bots). They’re flaky and may violate WhatsApp/Android policies—use with caution.

3) WhatsApp Business (for businesses only)
- No true “schedule to a person” either, but you can use approved providers (e.g., Twilio, MessageBird) with the WhatsApp Business API to schedule template messages to opted-in customers. This is overkill for personal use.
